channel.title: Runescape client
channel.description:
I'm looking to develop a client that will work for rs, but I'm not sure how much flexibility I will have. Am I able to see the classes and stuff like a 317? Or does Runescape have it completely different?
How would I go about it?

item.title: Runescape client
item.dc:creator: @Flame3 John
item.description:
@Flame3 wrote:

You would just need to load their client through your files if you choose to make a loader. Imthenull has a 2007 external loader, you could definitely base it off of that if you know what you’re doing.
To make one yourself from absolute scratch would involve loading the sprites, the client, the graphics, etc. all manually and you would need to have access to the IP address of every server (world), which, unless I am mistaken, is not available to the public.
Also, unless I am missing something, I don’t see the point in creating a loader when Jagex provides a downloadable client.
Prove me wrong, though.

Read full topic

item.title: Runescape client
item.dc:creator: @ohokay ohokay
item.description:
@ohokay wrote:

Flame_:

Are you planning to make one from scratch or to simply load it from their site?

Either. I’m guessing loading from their site would be easier than making one myself, but what would I have access to?

Read full topic
